sentence.Network_en: I don't want to be associated with your scheme; I'm contracting out.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不想参与你们的计划, 我要退出.

sentence.Network_en: He hesitated and added , the muscles of his face contracting whitely.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一脸的肌肉在皱缩发白,一面吞吞吐吐地接下去说.

sentence.Network_en: His insides contracting , Chicken George sat mutely.
sentence.Network_cn: 查坎·乔治内心感到抽缩, 一言不发地坐着.

entry.def: A contract is a legal agreement, usually between two companies or between an employer and employee, which involves doing work for a stated sum of money.

example.ex: The company won a prestigious contract for work on Europe's tallest building...
example.tran: 这家公司赢得了一份极为重要的合同，参与建设欧洲最高的大厦。

example.ex: He was given a seven-year contract with an annual salary of $150,000.
example.tran: 他签下了一份为期7年的合同，年薪为15万美元。

entry.tran: 签合同，订立契约(做某事)
entry.def: If you contract with someone to do something, you legally agree to do it for them or for them to do it for you.

example.ex: You can contract with us to deliver your cargo...
example.tran: 你可以跟我们签订送货合同。

example.ex: The Boston Museum of Fine Arts has already contracted to lease part of its collection to a museum in Japan.
example.tran: 波士顿美术博物馆已经签订合同，将其部分藏品租借给日本一家博物馆。

entry.def: When something contracts or when something contracts it, it becomes smaller or shorter.

example.ex: Blood is only expelled from the heart when it contracts...
example.tran: 血液在心脏收缩的时候从心脏流出。

example.ex: New research shows that an excess of meat and salt can contract muscles.
example.tran: 新的研究表明，过量食用肉类和盐可能会导致肌肉收缩。

entry.def: When something such as an economy or market contracts, it becomes smaller.

example.ex: The manufacturing economy contracted in October for the sixth consecutive month.
example.tran: 10月，制造业经济已经连续第6个月出现萎缩状况。

entry.def: If you contract a serious illness, you become ill with it.

example.ex: He contracted AIDS from a blood transfusion...
example.tran: 他因为输血而感染了艾滋病。

example.ex: Ovarian cancer is the sixth most common cancer contracted by women.
example.tran: 卵巢癌是女性常患的第六大癌症。

entry.def: If you contract a marriage, alliance, or other relationship with someone, you arrange to have that relationship with them.

example.ex: She contracted a formal marriage to a British ex-serviceman.
example.tran: 她和一个英国退役军人正式订婚了。

entry.def: If there is a contract on a person or on their life, someone has made an arrangement to have them killed.

example.ex: The convictions resulted in the local crime bosses putting a contract on him...
example.tran: 这些判罪导致当地犯罪团伙的老大们要雇凶杀他。

example.ex: The police advised her to get out of town because there was a contract on her life.
example.tran: 警察建议她离开这个城市，因为有人雇杀手杀她。

entry.def: If you are under contract to someone, you have signed a contract agreeing to work for them, and for no-one else, during a fixed period of time.

example.ex: The director wanted Olivia de Havilland, then under contract to Warner Brothers.
example.tran: 导演想要当时签约于华纳兄弟娱乐公司旗下的奥利维娅·德哈维兰出演。

sentences.sentence: "the contracting of a serious illness can be financially catastrophic"

auth_sentence.res_content: Its economy also is contracting, not growing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its economy also is contracting, not growing.

auth_sentence.content: Labour begins when the uterus starts contracting regularly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Labour begins when the uterus starts contracting regularly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Labour begins when the uterus starts contracting regularly.
